Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: In order to improve the banks' liquidity, the reserve base of banks' liabilities was curtailed, beginning from October 2007, by means of eliminating some short- term liabilities of a bank (such as Repo, overnight), subordinated debt, and perpetual financial instruments, along with accruals on them. The list of reserve assets of a bank has been expanded by adding to it a bank's hard currency cash at cash desks. Installing changes let the TTBs additionally release KZT 150 billion (the National Bank of Kazakhstan estimation). In November 2007, the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan, the National Bank of Kazakhstan, and the Agency signed the Memorandum on financial stability with the aim to maintain financial stability. The Memorandum determines the core principles of ensuring the financial stability, the tasks and roles of each Party in ensuring the financial stability pursuant to RoK laws; procedures for informational interaction as well as principles and mechanisms for minimizing the negative effect of any system crisis. In particular, the Agency, the Government, and the National Bank of Kazakhstan reached an agreement on principles of rendering the state support and procedures for using other vehicles of state regulation with the purpose of maintaining the financial stability.
